overview: Zechariah contains dramatic visions and detailed messianic prophecies. From the humble king riding a donkey to the pierced one for whom Israel will mourn, Zechariah points clearly to Jesus.

verses.text: Rejoice greatly, O daughter of Zion! Shout aloud, O daughter of Jerusalem! Behold, your king is coming to you; righteous and having salvation is he, humble and mounted on a donkey, on a colt, the foal of a donkey.

And I will pour out on the house of David and the inhabitants of Jerusalem a spirit of grace and pleas for mercy, so that, when they look on me, on him whom they have pierced, they shall mourn for him.
Not by might, nor by power, but by my Spirit, says the LORD of hosts.

passages.title: The King on a Donkey
passages.summary: A prophecy of the Messiah entering Jerusalem humbly on a donkey—fulfilled precisely on Palm Sunday.

passages.title: Thirty Pieces of Silver
passages.summary: The shepherd is valued at thirty pieces of silver, thrown to the potter—fulfilled in Judas's betrayal of Jesus.

facts.text: Zechariah is the most quoted Minor Prophet in the Gospels' Passion narratives—his prophecies saturate Holy Week.
Jesus rode into Jerusalem on a donkey explicitly to fulfill Zechariah 9:9 (Matthew 21:4-5).
Zechariah 4:6 is quoted whenever people need to remember that God's work is accomplished by His Spirit, not human effort.

figures.name: Zechariah
figures.description: A priest-prophet who encouraged the temple rebuilding through eight visions and pointed to the coming Messiah.

figures.name: Joshua (the High Priest)
figures.description: A high priest whom Zechariah sees symbolically cleansed, representing the nation's forgiveness and restoration.

videos.title: Zechariah Overview
videos.description: The Bible Project explores Zechariah's visions and messianic prophecies.
